original_title: Sri Lanka court restraints Golden Key Hospital directors from altering share register
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Several directors of Golden Key Hospitals Ltd were restrained from altering the share register, by an interim order issued by the Commercial High Court of the Western Province.

The order prevented A R Gunawardene, R Ranganathan and T N M Pieris from voting to approve the appointment of E.  T. L. Ranasinghe, P. D. M. Cooray, P. A. Jayawardena, S. R. Abeynayake, W. C. J. Alwis, H. D. K. P. Alwis and U. Witharana as Directors of Golden Key Hospitals Ltd.

They were prevented from taking any steps and/or acting in any manner to amend and/or alter the share register of the Golden Key Hospitals Ltd and/or the official records maintained with the Department of Registrar General of Companies in a manner which did not comply a Supreme Court order in an earlier case.
Gunawardana was Chairman, Ranganathan was Deputy Chairman and Pieris was Executive Director Ceylinco Insurance Company.

The petitioners were Additional Director Legal of the Ministry of Finance and Assistance Governor of the central bank, who were directors of Gold Key Hospitals, representing the interests of Golden Key Credit Card Company which was now controlled by the government.
Attorney-at-law Shivaan Cooray and Manjuka Fernandopulle law appeared for the Petitioners instructed by Sudath Perera Associates.    (Colombo/Aug06/2023)
